title: Dean Clark (rugby league)
text:
Dean Clark (born 6 January 1968) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> coach and former footballer who represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> between 1989 and 1992.
Playing career.
An <a href="Otahuhu%20Leopards">Otahuhu Leopards</a> junior, Clark joined the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs Roosters</a> in 1988 playing in seven matches.
Clark then travelled to England, joining <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the English competition.
Clark returned to New Zealand in 1995, playing for the in the <a href="Lion%20Red%20Cup">Lion Red Cup</a>.
Clark played with the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> in 1996, but was released from the club after one season.
Clark then moved to the <a href="Mangere%20East%20Hawks">Mangere East Hawks</a>, where he played in the 1998 Fox Memorial grand final.
In 1999 Clark joined the <a href="Otahuhu%20Leopards">Otahuhu Leopards</a>, and represented Auckland South.
Representative career.
An <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> representative, Clark played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Kiwis</a> seven times between 1989 and 1992. He was a trialist in 1993 but did not make the final Kiwis side.
Clark represented the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> in 1990, 1995 and at the <a href="1997%20Oceania%20Cup">1997 Oceania Cup</a>.
Clark played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Residents">New Zealand Residents</a> in 1990, 1992 and 1995.
Coaching career.
In the <a href="2000%20Bartercard%20Cup">2000 Bartercard Cup</a> Clark was the <a href="player-coach">player-coach</a> of the <a href="Otahuhu%20Leopards">Otahuhu Leopards</a>, his first coaching role. The Leopards made the grand final, losing 24-38 to the <a href="Canterbury%20Bulls">Canterbury Bulls</a>.
Clark coached the <a href="Tamaki%20Titans">Tamaki Titans</a> between 2006 and 2007 in the <a href="Bartercard%20Cup">Bartercard Cup</a>. He was the coach of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20M%C4%81ori%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand Māori</a> in 2006.
He coached the <a href="Papakura%20Sea%20Eagles">Papakura Sea Eagles</a> to seventh in <a href="2010%20Auckland%20Rugby%20League%20season">2010</a>, and again in 2011.
